abstract: Sets the character that specifies the date and time components.

codeExamples.code:
let meetingDate = Date() // Jun 23, 2021 at 10:21 AM
meetingDate.formatted(.iso8601.dateSeparator(.omitted)) // 20210623 152135Z
meetingDate.formatted(.iso8601.dateSeparator(.dash)) // 20210623T152135Z
meetingDate.formatted(.iso8601) // 20210623T152135Z

overview:
## Return Value

An ISO 8601 date format style with the provided date and time component separator.

## Discussion

Possible values of [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/Date/ISO8601FormatStyle/DateTimeSeparator-swift.enum] are [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/Date/ISO8601FormatStyle/DateTimeSeparator-swift.enum/space] and [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/Date/ISO8601FormatStyle/DateTimeSeparator-swift.enum/standard].

The following example shows a variety of [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/Date/ISO8601FormatStyle/DateTimeSeparator-swift.enum] formats applied to an ISO 8601 date format.

If no format is specified as a parameter, the [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/Date/ISO8601FormatStyle/DateTimeSeparator-swift.enum/standard] case is the default format.

For more information about ISO 8601 formatted dates, see the [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/Date/ISO8601FormatStyle].

# dateTimeSeparator(_:)

**Instance Method**

Sets the character that specifies the date and time components.

## Declaration

```swift
func dateTimeSeparator(_ separator: Date.ISO8601FormatStyle.DateTimeSeparator) -> Date.ISO8601FormatStyle
```

## Parameters

- **separator**: Possible values are `space` and `standard`.

## Return Value

An ISO 8601 date format style with the provided date and time component separator.

## Discussion

Possible values of [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/Date/ISO8601FormatStyle/DateTimeSeparator-swift.enum] are [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/Date/ISO8601FormatStyle/DateTimeSeparator-swift.enum/space] and [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/Date/ISO8601FormatStyle/DateTimeSeparator-swift.enum/standard].

The following example shows a variety of [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/Date/ISO8601FormatStyle/DateTimeSeparator-swift.enum] formats applied to an ISO 8601 date format.

```swift
let meetingDate = Date() // Jun 23, 2021 at 10:21 AM
meetingDate.formatted(.iso8601.dateSeparator(.omitted)) // 20210623 152135Z
meetingDate.formatted(.iso8601.dateSeparator(.dash)) // 20210623T152135Z
meetingDate.formatted(.iso8601) // 20210623T152135Z
```

If no format is specified as a parameter, the [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/Date/ISO8601FormatStyle/DateTimeSeparator-swift.enum/standard] case is the default format.

For more information about ISO 8601 formatted dates, see the [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/Date/ISO8601FormatStyle].

## Modifying an ISO 8601 Format Style

- **dateSeparator**: The character used to separate the components of a date.
- **dateTimeSeparator**: The character used to separate the date and time components of an ISO 8601 string representation of a date.
- **timeZone**: The time zone used to create and parse date representations.
